title: Assembly Machine
description:
Added info to this basically blank page.

I took a stab at making a chart to help folks get the impression of just how this machine changes material costs.

I used the Basic Circuit (probably the first machine component anyone uses this machine for), and tried to make the information fit and sit readably, with only mixed satisfaction at my final layout.

Please, someone find a way to do it better (not just differently) or especially add additional rows of example cost savings.

I have never used this machine at the extremely high tech levels, so if it is the only way to create certain components, or if it still saves significant material quantities of vastly rare and expensive endgame materials, I think that deserves special mention.

replies.body: it allows you to use platinum instead of iridium in some advanced components, saving iridium basically.
